rev.comment: The first paragraph is totally in error. Not only in colloqial use but etymologically, traditionally, & in the psychological literature, necrophilia refers strictly to erotic attraction to corpses.
rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1:
[[Image:Necromouse12hd.jpg|thumb|225px|right|Necrophilia, although commonly thought to be only done by humans, does in fact also occur amongst other species.]]
[[Image:Necromouse12hd.jpg|thumb|225px|right|Necrophilia, although commonly thought to be only done by humans, does in fact also occur amongst other species.]]
â
'''Necrophilia''' is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a [[sexual]] attraction to nonresponsive persons, including the [[coma]]tose and [[corpse]]s. Necrophilia is a primary motive behind the use of incapacitating chemicals (such as [[GHB]]) to commit date [[rape]]. The most [[sensationalism | sensationalized]] form of necrophilia is when it involves sex with the [[death | dead]], and in colloquial use "necrophilia" normally involves the dead.
+
'''Necrophilia''' according to the [[DSM IV]], is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a [[sexual]] attraction to [[corpse]]s.
Figuratively, the term "necrophilia" describes an inordinate desire to control another person, usually in the context of a [[romantic]] or interpersonal relationship; the accusation is that the person is so interpersonally controlling as to be better-suited to relationships with nonresponsive people.
Figuratively, the term "necrophilia" describes an inordinate desire to control another person, usually in the context of a [[romantic]] or interpersonal relationship; the accusation is that the person is so interpersonally controlling as to be better-suited to relationships with nonresponsive people.
